intro: Disticholiparis mucronata, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in a dense layer of fine, velvety hairs. The plant produces showy, pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that release small, wind-dispersed seeds. Disticholiparis mucronata is often found in disturbed habitats and is considered an invasive species in some regions.
